scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The Aura Levitas Tamiment Playhouse Photographs document several different performances at the Camp Tamiment's summer theater in sixteen black and white photographic prints.

Performers included are Aura Vainio, David Hollister, Faith Dane, Jimmy Starbuck, Kirsten Valbor, Mary Ellen Terry, Beryl Towbin, Genie Pryor, and Lila Lee. The sets of Willard Levitas and choreography of Herbert Ross are also pictured, as is the exterior of the Tamiment Playhouse. Four prints are signed by photographer Alexander Cohen and two are attributed to Lewis "Snappy" Goren.

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: The Tamiment Playhouse was a summer theater at Camp Tamiment. The camp, which operated near Bushkill, Pennsylvania from 1921-1965, was an educational and recreational resort affiliated with the socialist Rand School of Social Science. The playhouse was started to provide campers with entertainment, but it soon became a preeminent workshop for theater, dance, film, and television. Many prominent entertainers of the mid-twentieth century counted Camp Tamiment in their training.
Aura Levitas performed at Camp Tamiment and would later work as a dancer on Broadway and television. Her husband Willard Levitas was a set designer.
